this to indicate it is predictive error
this will impact others using this method and do not see need for this change.
We need this change, if not it will add another callout even if the callout list is empty
do we need 2? should go into logging guard traces commit
this change is irerelvant to this commit and it is not explained in the commit message
Removed the changes. Will commit it later as part of a different commit
should we still call it read error
this should go into "enabling logging of guard library traces" commit

I think you are passing error severity as "Error" so that means it should be an "Unrecoverable" error, right? https://github.com/openbmc/phosphor-logging/blob/master/extensions/openpower-pels/severity.cpp#L36
I am passing error severity as warning. It was decided that we will keep it as predictive. That part is in the openpower-proc-control
I think we should not reset the trace because we are trying to continue the IPLing, right? if so, we will lose all traces if we are hitting any error after the "IPL_ERR_INVALID_GUARD_FILE".

Resetting the trace removes it only from the internal vector that we use for adding the log to the PEL. We reset because those are already added to the PEL log. This will not clear any further messages.
It will be great if you added like, "why we did not reset the buffer for this error case alone" in the commit message
I think adding it to the commit message shall confuse. So believe better not to add.
LGTM , Required phosphor-logging commit related to new error code support.
Required IPL version bump and phosphor-logging support before merging this code.
Please share IPL version bump link.

IPL version bump completed and the changes are in fw1030.00-5.6 (https://github.ibm.com/openbmc/openbmc/pull/2910/files)
I will get the phosphor-logging merged.
https://gerrit.openbmc.org/c/openbmc/phosphor-logging/+/57689 This is the link to phosphor-logging changes merged
